greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common prime divisor of n and sigma_2(n) = A001157(n), or 1 if the two are relatively prime.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: (* factors/exponent SET *) ffi[x_] := Flatten[FactorInteger[x]]; lf[x_] := Length[FactorInteger[x]]; ba[x_] := Table[Part[ffi[x], 2*w-1], {w, 1, lf[x]}]; f1[x_] := x; f2[x_] := DivisorSigma[2, x]; Table[Max[Intersection[ba[f1[w]], ba[f2[w]]]], {w, 1, 128}]
Array[If[CoprimeQ[#1, #2], 1, Max@ Apply[Intersection, Map[FactorInteger[#][[All, 1]] &, {#1, #2}]]] & @@ {#, DivisorSigma[2, #]} &, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 03 2017 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 07 2003
ext: Erroneous comment removed by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 03 2017
